conclusion: To determine the direction of the particle's motion from 2 to 3 seconds, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The y-axis represents velocity v in meters per second (m/s). The x-axis represents time t in seconds (s).
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity is negative (below the x-axis).
A positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction. A negative velocity indicates motion in the opposite (negative) direction.

premise: Since the velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds.
conclusion: The particle is moving in the direction opposite to the defined positive direction.
